briefTitle: A Study Comparing Exenatide With Basal Insulin in Achieving a Target HbA1c With Minimum Weight Gain in Type 2 Diabetes Patients

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes
* Currently being treated with the following: Dual or triple oral therapy - on a stable combination and dose for at least 3 months.
* HbA1c between 7.5% and 10.0%.
* BMI \>27.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Receive chronic (lasting longer than 2 weeks) systemic glucocorticoid therapy (excluding topical and inhaled preparations) or have received such therapy within 2 weeks immediately prior to study.
* Have participated in an interventional medical, surgical, or pharmaceutical study (a study in which a medical or surgical treatment was given) within 30 days prior to entry into the study.
* Treatment with the following medications: \*Insulin as outpatient therapy within last 3 months; \*Meglitinides, or acarbose within the last 3 months; \*Regular use of any drugs that directly affect gastrointestinal motility; \*Any previous (study) therapy with exenatide or glucagon-like peptide-1 (GLP-1) analogue; \*Anti-obesity agent use within the last 3 months.
* Have received treatment within the last 30 days with a drug that has not received regulatory approval for any indication at the time of study entry.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent of Patients Who Achieved HbA1c ≤ 7.4% With Minimal Weight Gain (≤ 1kg)
outcomeMeasures.description: Composite endpoint evaluating effect of treatment on glycemic control and weight

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent of Patients Who Achieved HbA1c ≤ 7.4% and Weight Gain ≤ 0.5kg
outcomeMeasures.description: Composite endpoint evaluating effect of treatment on glycemic control and weight

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Fasting Serum Glucose
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in fasting serum glucose from baseline (week 0) to endpoint (week 26)

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent of Patients Achieving HbA1c ≤ 7.4%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent of patients achieving specified HbA1c target at endpoint

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent of Patients Achieving HbA1c < 7%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent of patients achieving specified HbA1c target at endpoint

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent of Patients Achieving HbA1c < 6.5%
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent of patients achieving specified HbA1c target at endpoint

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in 7 Point Self Monitored Blood Glucose Profile
outcomeMeasures.description: Change from baseline to endpoint in self monitored blood glucose levels measured at 7 time points during the day

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Body Mass Index (BMI)
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in BMI from baseline to endpoint

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Waist Circumference
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in waist circumference from baseline to endpoint

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Waist-to-hip Ratio
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in waist-to-hip ratio from baseline to endpoint

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Body Weight
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in body weight from baseline to endpoint

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent Change in Body Weight

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent of Patients Achieving 5% Weight Loss
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent of patients who lost at least 5% of baseline body weight at endpoint

outcomeMeasures.title: Percent of Patients Achieving 10% Weight Loss
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent of patients who lost at least 10% of baseline body weight at endpoint

outcomeMeasures.description: Change in TC to HDL cholesterol ratio from baseline to endpoint

outcomeMeasures.description: Change in fasting serum triglycerides from baseline to endpoint

outcomeMeasures.description: Change in apolipoprotein-B from baseline to endpoint

outcomeMeasures.title: Incidence of Hypoglycemic Episodes
outcomeMeasures.description: Percent of total patients in each arm experiencing hypoglycemia at any point in the 26 week study

outcomeMeasures.description: Percent of total patients in each arm experiencing severe hypoglycemia at any point during the 26 week study
